definition: to put on an attitude/to pose
to do/to grow/to write or compose/to pretend/to regard as/to feel/writings or works

sentences.english: The brotherhood of man on earth will be possible only on a base of kitsch .
sentences.chinese: 地球上人的博爱将只可能以媚俗作态为基础。

sentences.english: This is something you can figure out for yourself, but you are being coy .
sentences.chinese: 这是你自己就可以弄清楚的东西，但你是在忸怩作态。

sentences.english: Make no mistake, Microsoft isn't playing coy in the smartphone market any longer.
sentences.chinese: 别搞错，微软不再在智能手机市场上忸怩作态了。

sentences.english: What I hate is the way he's always rubbing his hand together, "Washing his hands with invisible soap and imperceptible water."
sentences.chinese: 我看不惯的是他那总是忸怩作态地搓手的样子。

sentences.english: Learn moderation in everything, and try not to be hypocritical.
sentences.chinese: 学习在任何事情都得中庸，并且试着别惺惺作态。

sentences.english: I don't know. - Don't be so coy , dear.
sentences.chinese: 这是你自己就可以弄清楚的东西，但你是在忸怩作态。

definition: way of doing sth/behavior/to act in an affected manner/mannerism/gestures in opera
to fawn on/to ingratiate oneself/(literary) to meet face to face
to boast/to blow one's own horn
display of wild manners/scandalous scene/insolent and conceited manners
